API Reference

This section provides a minimal API reference for core utility modules. More modules can be added here as the project matures.

Configuration Utilities

Configuration management utilities.

This module handles: - Loading multiple YAML config files (base, dataset, model, experiment). - Deep-merging them in a predictable order. - Expanding environment variables in YAML values (e.g. “${DATA_ROOT}/nih_cxr”). - Validating the final configuration against a schema (Pydantic models). - Computing a stable hash of the resolved configuration for provenance. - Optional saving of the resolved config for experiment reproducibility.

Typical usage in a training script:

from src.utils.config import (

load_experiment_config, save_resolved_config, get_config_hash,

) from src.utils.reproducibility import set_global_seed

cfg = load_experiment_config(

“configs/base.yaml”, “configs/datasets/nih_cxr_debug.yaml”, “configs/models/resnet50.yaml”, “configs/experiments/nih_triobj_debug.yaml”,

)

# Access fields: cfg.training.max_epochs cfg.dataset.batch_size cfg.model.name cfg.reproducibility.seed

# Optional: save fully-resolved config & hash for provenance save_resolved_config(cfg, “results/configs/last_run.yaml”) print(“Config hash:”, get_config_hash(cfg))

class src.utils.config.DatasetConfig(*, name: str, root: str, batch_size: Annotated[int, Gt(gt=0)] = 64, num_workers: Annotated[int, Ge(ge=0)] = 4, pin_memory: bool = True, train_subset: Annotated[int | None, Gt(gt=0)] = None, test_subset: Annotated[int | None, Gt(gt=0)] = None, **extra_data: Any)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Configuration for dataset loading and DataLoader behaviour.

extra=’allow’ permits you to add dataset-specific fields in YAML without breaking the schema, e.g. img_size, augmentation flags, etc.

batch_size: int
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'extra': 'allow'}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

name: str
num_workers: int
pin_memory: bool
root: str
test_subset: int | None
train_subset: int | None
class src.utils.config.ExperimentConfig(*, experiment: ~src.utils.config.ExperimentMeta, dataset: ~src.utils.config.DatasetConfig, model: ~src.utils.config.ModelConfig, training: ~src.utils.config.TrainingConfig, reproducibility: ~src.utils.config.ReproducibilityConfig, yaml_stack: ~typing.List[str] = <factory>)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Final validated configuration object.

Top-level fields mirror the YAML structure: - experiment: ExperimentMeta - dataset: DatasetConfig - model: ModelConfig - training: TrainingConfig - reproducibility: ReproducibilityConfig

Additional field: - yaml_stack: ordered list of YAML paths used to construct this config.

This is filled in by load_experiment_config and is extremely helpful for provenance (e.g. logging to MLflow).

dataset: DatasetConfig
experiment: ExperimentMeta
model: ModelConfig
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'extra': 'ignore'}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

reproducibility: ReproducibilityConfig
training: TrainingConfig
yaml_stack: List[str]
class src.utils.config.ExperimentMeta(*, name: str, description: str | None = None, project_name: str = 'tri-objective-robust-xai-medimg', tags: ~typing.Dict[str, str] = <factory>, **extra_data: ~typing.Any)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Human-visible metadata for the experiment.

This is what you would typically surface in MLflow / W&B / logs.

description: str | None
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'extra': 'allow'}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

name: str
project_name: str
tags: Dict[str, str]
class src.utils.config.ModelConfig(*, name: str, num_classes: Annotated[int, Gt(gt=0)], pretrained: bool = False, checkpoint_path: str | None = None, **extra_data: Any)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Configuration for the model architecture and checkpoints.

extra=’allow’ so you can attach arbitrary model hyperparameters in YAML without changing the schema (e.g. depth, width, dropout, etc.).

checkpoint_path: str | None
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'extra': 'allow'}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

name: str
num_classes: int
pretrained: bool
class src.utils.config.ReproducibilityConfig(*, seed: Annotated[int, Ge(ge=0)] = 42, deterministic_cudnn: bool = True, benchmark_cudnn: bool = False, enable_tf32: bool = False, use_deterministic_algorithms: bool = False, dataloader_seed_offset: Annotated[int, Ge(ge=0)] = 0)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Configuration of all reproducibility-related knobs.

This is intentionally slightly more detailed than simply a “seed”, so that you can explicitly state in the config whether you want deterministic algorithms, cuDNN benchmarking, TF32, etc.

benchmark_cudnn: bool
dataloader_seed_offset: int
deterministic_cudnn: bool
enable_tf32: bool
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'extra': 'forbid'}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

seed: int
use_deterministic_algorithms: bool
class src.utils.config.TrainingConfig(*, max_epochs: Annotated[int, Gt(gt=0)], device: Annotated[str, _PydanticGeneralMetadata(pattern='^(cpu|cuda(:[0-9]+)?)$')] = 'cuda', eval_every_n_epochs: Annotated[int, Gt(gt=0)] = 1, log_every_n_steps: Annotated[int, Gt(gt=0)] = 50, gradient_clip_val: Annotated[float, Ge(ge=0)] = 0.0, learning_rate: Annotated[float, Gt(gt=0)] = 0.001, weight_decay: Annotated[float, Ge(ge=0)] = 0.0, **extra_data: Any)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Configuration for the training loop and optimiser.

extra=’allow’ allows you to extend this later with scheduler, warmup, tri-objective weights, etc., without having to adjust the schema.

device: str
eval_every_n_epochs: int
gradient_clip_val: float
learning_rate: float
log_every_n_steps: int
max_epochs: int
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'extra': 'allow'}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

weight_decay: float
src.utils.config.get_config_hash(cfg: ExperimentConfig, algo: str = 'sha256') → str[source]

Compute a stable hash of the resolved configuration.

Extremely useful for: - tagging MLflow runs with a config_hash - checking whether two runs used exactly the same configuration - reporting in the dissertation that each experimental condition

is uniquely identified by a hash over all hyperparameters.

src.utils.config.load_experiment_config(*paths: str | Path) → ExperimentConfig[source]

Load, merge and validate an experiment configuration from multiple YAML files.

The order of paths matters: later files override earlier ones. A common pattern is:

cfg = load_experiment_config(

“configs/base.yaml”, “configs/datasets/nih_cxr_debug.yaml”, “configs/models/resnet50.yaml”, “configs/experiments/nih_triobj_debug.yaml”,

)

src.utils.config.save_resolved_config(cfg: ExperimentConfig, path: str | Path) → None[source]

Save the fully resolved configuration to a single YAML file.

This is useful for logging the exact config used in a given run for full reproducibility.

Reproducibility Utilities

Reproducibility utilities for deterministic experiments. Handles seed setting, environment configuration, and reproducibility state tracking.

class src.utils.reproducibility.ReproducibilityState(seed: int, deterministic: bool, python_version: str, torch_version: str, cuda_available: bool, cuda_device_count: int, cuda_device_names: Tuple[str, ...], cudnn_deterministic: bool, cudnn_benchmark: bool, extra: Dict[str, Any])[source]

Bases: object

Snapshot of key reproducibility-related settings and environment.

cuda_available: bool
cuda_device_count: int
cuda_device_names: Tuple[str, ...]
cudnn_benchmark: bool
cudnn_deterministic: bool
deterministic: bool
extra: Dict[str, Any]
python_version: str
seed: int
torch_version: str
src.utils.reproducibility.get_reproducibility_state(seed: int, deterministic: bool) → ReproducibilityState[source]

Capture current reproducibility state.

src.utils.reproducibility.log_reproducibility_to_mlflow(state: ReproducibilityState) → None[source]

Best-effort logging of reproducibility info to MLflow, if available.

src.utils.reproducibility.make_torch_generator(seed: int) → Generator[source]

Create a torch.Generator with a given seed.

src.utils.reproducibility.quick_determinism_check(seed: int = 12345, device: device | None = None) → bool[source]

Run a tiny deterministic check.

Returns:

True if two forward passes with the same seed produce identical tensors.

src.utils.reproducibility.reproducibility_header(seed: int, deterministic: bool) → str[source]

Short header suitable for logging / MLflow tags.

src.utils.reproducibility.seed_worker(worker_id: int) → None[source]

DataLoader worker init function for reproducible workers.

Usage:

loader = DataLoader(

dataset, batch_size=…, num_workers=…, worker_init_fn=seed_worker, generator=torch.Generator().manual_seed(seed),

)

Follows the pattern recommended in the PyTorch docs.

src.utils.reproducibility.set_global_seed(seed: int, deterministic: bool = True, *, logger: Logger | None = None) → ReproducibilityState[source]

Set random seeds for Python, NumPy and PyTorch (CPU + CUDA).

src.utils.reproducibility.summarise_reproducibility_state(state: ReproducibilityState) → str[source]

Pretty-print a summary string for logs / README / thesis appendix.
